result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dillon L Flowers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dillon L Flowers appeared by video.  Attorney James Gregory McCann appeared by video for Dillon L Flowers.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dillon L Flowers in court with attorney James Gregory McCann.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dillon L Flowers appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense counsel informed the Court that this case is in Deferred Prosecution Agreement posture and requests additional time.  
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dillon L Flowers in court with attorney James Gregory McCann.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests an adjournment due to a personal conflict.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dillon L Flowers in court with attorney James Gregory McCann.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Status Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and a potential dpa Offer. State confirms the Offer pending tad evaluation results.
Defense request time for defendant to advantage of the State's Offer. Court orderd matter adjourned back to Branch 19.Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dillon L Flowers in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.  Case in court for Status of Counsel. 
 Indigency Hearing held. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney James McCann  to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $45.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin 30 Days after the conclusion of the case.  
Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment. Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel.  
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  This hearing will be in Person. Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dillon L Flowers in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference. Defense request time to hire counsel and request an adjournment.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79.
Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.

Defendant Dillon L Flowers in court.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
